item.title: Hello, It's Me!
item.description: Hello, it's me: Elena! I am a third year biology student at UT Austin studying ecology, evolution, and animal behavior, with a certificate in applied statistical modeling. I am interested in nearly every aspect of biology, but my true passion is for ecology, specifically urban ecology. I am a researcher, a homebody, a plant collector, and an aspiring farm animal sanctuary owner (ok maybe not but one can dream, right?

item.title: Python Stuff!
item.description: So.. Coding, Huh. Coding is hard. Truly, it is. However! Learning how to program, even just the basics, is an essential tool for many (all?) in today's technologically saturated world. For researchers and scientists of any capacity it is an incredibly necessary and useful tool to explore, manipulate, and make sense of your data. It's not so scary; here's a simple Python code chunk: print("When the robots take over, we'll have to learn their language!

item.title: Project 2: Modeling, Testing, and Predicting
item.description: My Project My project will use data from quadrat surveys of plant cover on Mt St. Helens from 1995 to 2009. A joined dataset featuring quadrat cover information (richness, diversity, etc) with a dataset containing plot descriptors (coordinates, succession type, etc), was joined by Plot ID to be used for this project. The variables of interest here include: primary impact type, succession type (categorical); percent cover, richness, H prime (Shannon diversity index) and elevation (numeric); and multiple vs.

item.title: Project 1: Exploratory Data Analysis
item.description: My Project My project will use data from quadrat surveys of plant cover on Mt St. Helens from 1995 to 2009. I will join a dataset with quadrat cover information (richness, diversity, etc) with a dataset containing plot descriptors (coordinates, succession type, etc), joined by Plot ID. library(tidyverse) Loading in the data structure <- read.csv("MSH_STRUCTURE_PLOT_YEAR.csv") descriptors <- read.csv("MSH_PLOT_DESCRIPTORS.csv") Fixing and Tidying structure_final <- structure %>% unite("PLOT_CODE", 2:3) descriptors_final <- descriptors %>% separate(PLOT_CODE, into = c("PLOT_NAME", "PLOT_NUM BER"), sep = 4, convert = T) %>% structure %>% unite("PLOT_CODE", 2:3) %>% separate(IMPACT_TYPE, into = c("IMPACT_TYPE_1", "IMPACT_TYPE_2", "IMPACT_TYPE_3"), sep = ";", convert = T) structure_final <- structure_final %>% group_by(PLOT_CODE) %>% slice(1) structure_final <- structure_final %>% subset(PLOT_CODE !
